Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 35 points and the Oklahoma City Thunder won their 11th straight game, beating the short-handed Memphis Grizzlies 130-106.
Rookie Ajay Mitchell scored 17 points, Aaron Wiggins contributed 16 and Jalen Williams added 14 points and 10 rebounds for the Thunder.
Gilgeous-Alexander made 14 of 19 shots to go along with seven assists, six rebounds and a team-high four blocks.
Oklahoma City blocked nine shots, including three by center Isaiah Hartenstein.
Desmond Bane had 22 points and nine rebounds for Memphis.
Jay Huff added 17 points but Jaren Jackson Jr. managed 13 points on 3-of-17 shooting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Oklahoma City converted 21 Memphis turnovers into 33 points.
The Thunder led 76-50 at halftime behind 23 points from Gilgeous-Alexander and 12 each from Mitchell and Kenrich Williams.
Memphis played without star Ja Morant (shoulder) and Zach Edey, who was in concussion protocol.
